title: Crypto’s Worst Six Months Yet? North Korea Hacks Lead to $2.1B in Thefts
body: Crypto investors lost over $2.1 billion to hacks and exploits in the first half of 2025, marking the worst six-month period on record for crypto security and an indication of some nation-states intensifying their cyber campaigns in the crypto space. The 75 recorded incidents crossed the previous H1 high from 2022 by roughly 10% and nearly match the entire 2024 total, a TRM Labs report released Friday said. But raising alarms is who is doing a major part of the stealing. Researchers say North Korean-linked groups are responsible for $1.6 billion, or 70% of all stolen funds this year. At the center of the surge is the $1.5 billion Bybit hack in February, now believed to have been carried out by North Korea, marking the largest crypto theft in history and skewing the year’s average hack size to $30 million — or double last year’s levels. The threat isn’t limited to Pyongyang. On June 18, a group believed to be linked to Israel, Gonjeshke Darande (Predatory Sparrow), stole $90 million from Iranian exchange Nobitex, reportedly in retaliation for the platform’s alleged role in sanction evasion. The stolen funds were sent to vanity addresses (which are un-spendable by design and sent tokens are deemed burnt), suggesting a political motive over profit. Attack vectors are evolving fast. Over 80% of stolen funds stemmed from infrastructure-level breaches, including private key thefts and front-end hijacks. These attacks, often involving social engineering or insider access, are proving to be ten times more lucrative than traditional smart contract exploits. DeFi vulnerabilities, including flash loan and reentrancy attacks, which were prevalent in 2021-22, accounted for a relatively small 12% of the losses. Read more: North Korean Hackers Are Targeting Top Crypto Firms With Malware Hidden in Job Applications

title: Top 5 Crypto Trading Platforms for 2025: What’s New, What’s Next
body: BitcoinWorld Top 5 Crypto Trading Platforms for 2025: What’s New, What’s Next Crypto trading is undergoing a structural shift in 2025. Fee structures are being dismantled, user experience is moving front and center, and regulatory alignment is now a competitive edge rather than a hurdle. For platforms operating across markets in Africa, Asia, and Europe, localization and compliance are no longer optional, they’re fundamental. While liquidity and token depth still matter, the differentiators have changed. Traders are gravitating toward platforms that reduce friction, offer better educational tools, and integrate seamlessly into local financial systems. This article looks at five trading platforms navigating that shift. Some are already adapting to a changing landscape. Others are players making inroads where global exchanges have struggled. Each offers a distinct advantage—from zero-fee models and localized onboarding to aggressive altcoin support. Together, they reflect a broader trend: crypto trading is maturing, and platforms are ahead of their pace. 1. Binance Binance remains the world’s largest exchange by trading volume, and in 2025 it combines deep liquidity with evolving features. Its standard spot market offers hundreds of crypto pairs, while its peer-to-peer section allows one to swap tokens directly with other users without fees. Beginners appreciate that Binance’s “Lite Mode” transforms a cumbersome dashboard into a clean, card-style view where prices and purchase buttons are easy to navigate on the screen. This interface guides users smoothly from depositing fiat to executing their first buy order. Advanced traders still have access to margin, futures, staking options, and a growing NFT marketplace, but those options sit behind clear menus, away from casual users until they are ready to explore further. Security on Binance continues to be robust. Two-factor authentication is mandatory, withdrawal whitelist features protect your assets, and the exchange’s Secure Asset Fund for Users offers a safety net in case of breaches. Binance’s ongoing commitment to regulatory compliance, establishing local entities in over twenty countries and integrating KYC that respect user privacy and bring trust without sacrificing convenience. 2. Uniswap As the leading decentralized exchange on Ethereum, Uniswap has set the standard for permissionless trading. Version 3, which launched in late 2023, introduced concentrated liquidity, allowing liquidity providers to choose custom price ranges for their funds. This innovation boosts capital efficiency and often translates into tighter spreads for traders. On Uniswap’s web and mobile interfaces, swapping tokens takes only a few clicks. You connect your wallet, select the tokens, approve the transaction, and confirm on your wallet, no registration or identity checks required. In 2025, Uniswap’s user experience has improved further. A newly designed interface offers one-click “gas optimization,” automatically bundling transactions into a single on-chain operation to reduce costs. Chart overlays and simple limit-order functionality mean regular traders no longer need separate tools. Community-driven governance ensures feature requests move from proposal to reality easily. For anyone who values true decentralization and permissionless trades, Uniswap tops the list. 3. VTrader VTrader is quietly building a reputation for turning crypto into a social experience. From the moment you open the app, it feels more like sending a text than placing an order in an exchange. Instead of memorizing long wallet addresses, you tap a friend’s phone number or search your contact list to send Bitcoin, Ethereum, or dozens of other major tokens. Behind the scenes, VTrader stakes user deposits on reputable proof-of-stake networks , and those staking rewards cover network fees. This approach means zero transaction fees for P2P transfers and trades between contacts. Beyond the core peer-to-peer feature, VTrader offers a clean, intuitive dashboard where price charts and balance summaries live alongside learning modules. Short video explainers and guided tutorials pop up at relevant moments, such as the first time you open a new token pair or attempt a swap. Security is front and center: the company is registered with FinCEN in the United States, adheres to PCI DSS standards, and stores private keys in hardware security modules. For beginners in regions like Nigeria, Ghana, and Kenya, VTrader’s in-app community events and the VTrader Academy give extra support, matching new users with local tutors who earn rewards for teaching. By blending social convenience, educational content, and solid compliance, VTrader turns a complex process into something seamless. 1inch While Uniswap shines on Ethereum, 1inch excels at finding the best prices across decentralized exchanges on multiple networks, including Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Avalanche, and beyond. By acting as an aggregator, 1inch splits your trade across several liquidity pools, squeezing out minimal slippage and optimal rates. On its interface, beginners see a “Best Price” tag next to each token swap, and the platform offers simple toggles to adjust gas limits or routing preferences without overwhelming technical jargon. In 2025, 1inch has rolled out advanced features like limit and stop orders directly on its DEX aggregator, a rare feature in DeFI. It also offers a one-click “gas token” function to reward users in the platform’s native tokens when network fees drop. For those who are keen on a decentralized option but dislike switching between apps for price checks, 1inch provides an all-in-one solution that feels more like a centralized exchange in convenience but upholds the permissionless benefits of DeFi. 5. Kraken Regulation and reputation matter more than ever, and Kraken stands out as one of the most trusted centralized exchanges in the world. Founded in 2011, it pioneered features like fiat onramps in over 50 countries, bank-grade security, and encrypted account information. Kraken’s interface is split into a simple “Starter” view for newcomers, showing only essential trading pairs and buy/sell buttons; and an “Advanced” view for those who want detailed order books, charting tools, and margin options. In 2025, Kraken has enhanced its educational offering with on-site webinars, live Q&A sessions, and an integrated learning center that complements each feature. Users gain confidence through simulated trading practice before they commit real funds. Kraken’s stablecoin pairs and futures markets have low trading fees, and its Proof-of-Reserve audits, published quarterly, reinforce transparency. If you want a platform that combines regulatory compliance, institutional-grade security, and a clear path for beginners, Kraken remains a top choice. Setting the pace for a new era of Crypto Trading In 2025, crypto trading is smarter, smoother, and more personalized than ever. AI assistants, seamless cross-chain swaps, and hybrid wallets are becoming the norm—not the future. Whether you’re drawn to VTrader’s social flair, Uniswap’s decentralization, or Binance’s institutional edge, the options are stacked. Each platform has its edge, try a few, feel them out. No more compromises. Just the right tools for your style, finally within reach. This post Top 5 Crypto Trading Platforms for 2025: What’s New, What’s Next first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Keshav Aggarwal

title: Ripple (XRP) vs SEC: Trial Lawyer Shares Comprehensive Thoughts On Torres’s Recent Decision
body: In a detailed and thought-provoking analysis, prominent trial attorney Fred Rispoli has weighed in on Judge Analisa Torres’s latest ruling in the long-running legal battle between Ripple and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). His commentary highlights not only the complexities of the case but also the broader implications for crypto regulation under the current political climate. Torres’s Ruling: A Puzzling Denial Judge Torres recently denied a joint motion by Ripple and the SEC that sought to reduce Ripple’s penalty from $125 million to $50 million and lift the injunction restricting its future institutional XRP sales. According to Rispoli, the court had a clear path to grant the motion. Given the SEC’s ongoing leadership transition and shifting stance toward crypto under the Trump administration, many expected a more flexible judicial response. Instead, Torres rejected the motion outright. Rispoli suggests two possible reasons: either the judge was frustrated after spending more than four years on intense litigation between the parties, or she may harbor political bias against the new administration. While he stops short of confirming the latter, he points out that politically motivated decisions are not unheard of in the federal judiciary and vows to follow Judge Torres’s future rulings more closely. SEC v. Ripple Update: This is a long post on my thoughts here but the TLDR is: "Welcome to the new SEC, for now more or less the same as the last one." And: Ripple and SEC will settle the appeal for the reduced, agreed upon amount and leave the Torres judgment in place, while the… https://t.co/9y9o4M4uBW — Fred Rispoli (@freddyriz) June 26, 2025 Missed Opportunities by Ripple and the SEC Rispoli’s most pointed criticism lies in how poorly the motion was presented. On pages three and four of the ruling, Judge Torres cites the SEC’s prior language describing Ripple’s actions as “egregious,” “reckless,” and “dangerous.” This undermines claims that Ripple deserves leniency without a significant shift in its story. Rispoli argues that this motion should have included signed declarations from SEC commissioners, publicly acknowledging that the agency’s prior stance was flawed. If Commissioner Hester Peirce or SEC Chair Paul Atkins had publicly disagreed with Gary Gensler’s enforcement approach, it might have influenced the court’s view. Their silence, he says, signals a refusal within the SEC to admit past mistakes, even under new leadership. Whether due to a lack of coordination or outright refusal, the failure to present a strong and updated case contributed to the motion’s collapse. In Rispoli’s view, this reflects a systemic problem—an institutional instinct to protect the agency at all costs, even if it means undermining progress or fairness. A Likely Settlement Path Despite this setback, Rispoli is confident that the case is heading toward a final resolution. He predicts that Ripple and the SEC will eventually settle the appeal quietly, agreeing to the $50 million penalty while leaving Judge Torres’s core ruling in place. The decision that XRP is not a security in secondary market sales will stand , and the permanent injunction will remain largely symbolic. While the SEC previously announced its intent to drop the appeal, Rispoli remains skeptical that it will do so in a way that truly benefits Ripple, such as by failing to respond to Ripple’s appellate brief, which would give Ripple a near-certain win. Instead, he expects a joint dismissal of all appeals to avoid further scrutiny from the courts. Understanding the Injunction A key concern among XRP holders has been the court’s injunction against Ripple’s XRP institutional sales. Rispoli, however, argues that the injunction carries little practical weight unless the SEC actively chooses to enforce it. Judge Torres herself acknowledged this, noting that any enforcement would require a separate motion. Importantly, the injunction does not apply to secondary market transactions and will not impede any potential XRP ETF approvals. Rispoli also raises a legal point that has largely gone unaddressed—whether the SEC can issue waivers to override restrictions created by the injunction. According to his research, the SEC does have that authority, though whether it will use it remains uncertain. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Ripple’s Operational Shift Another telling detail emerged from Ripple Chief Legal Officer Stuart Alderoty’s statement following the court ruling. He referred to the company’s past behavior as “historic institutional sales”—a subtle yet significant change in language. Rispoli interprets this as a strategic signal that Ripple has adjusted its business practices to comply with the legal boundaries set by Judge Torres. This language shift likely reflects an unspoken understanding between Ripple and the SEC. The company will continue institutional sales in a manner that aligns with current regulatory expectations, while the SEC agrees not to pursue further enforcement, at least under the current leadership. A Broken System and the Case for Crypto Rispoli closes with a strong critique of the SEC as an institution. Drawing on years of experience litigating against government agencies, he describes a system that prioritizes self-preservation over accountability. He cites past scandals, like the SEC’s misconduct in the Debt Box case, as evidence of a deeper institutional rot. His support for crypto, he explains, stems from the desire to “opt out of a crumbling system.” For him, blockchain represents more than innovation—it’s a way to build a more transparent, accountable financial future, free from the bureaucratic failings that continue to plague agencies like the SEC. Fred Rispoli’s analysis sheds light on not just the legal minutiae of the Ripple case but also the broader institutional and political currents shaping its trajectory. While Judge Torres’s decision dealt a temporary blow to Ripple’s hopes of closing this chapter, the path to resolution appears clear. A settlement is likely, XRP remains unaffected in secondary markets, and Ripple seems poised to move forward, armed with lessons, legal clarity, and a commitment to compliance in a still-uncertain regulatory landscape. title: US Spot Bitcoin ETFs Achieve Remarkable 13-Day Inflow Streak, Signaling Robust Confidence
body: BitcoinWorld US Spot Bitcoin ETFs Achieve Remarkable 13-Day Inflow Streak, Signaling Robust Confidence Are you tracking the pulse of the cryptocurrency market? If so, you’ve likely noticed a compelling trend that’s capturing the attention of investors worldwide: the consistent and substantial inflows into US Spot Bitcoin ETFs . This isn’t just a fleeting moment; it’s a powerful signal of growing confidence and institutional interest in Bitcoin, marking a significant shift in the digital asset landscape. What’s Driving the Surge in US Spot Bitcoin ETFs? The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with positive news as US Spot Bitcoin ETFs continue their impressive run. On June 26, these investment vehicles collectively logged a staggering $226.37 million in net inflows, extending a remarkable 13-day streak of positive capital injection. This sustained interest highlights a deepening conviction among investors regarding Bitcoin’s long-term value and its increasing acceptance as a legitimate asset class. Leading the charge in these substantial inflows is BlackRock’s IBIT, which alone attracted $163.46 million. Following closely were Fidelity’s FBTC with $32.85 million and Bitwise’s BITB contributing $25.16 million. Even smaller players like Franklin’s EZBC and ARK Invest’s ARKB saw modest yet meaningful inflows of $3.11 million and $1.79 million, respectively. This widespread participation across various ETF providers underscores a broad-based demand for regulated Bitcoin exposure. These consistent Bitcoin Inflows are not merely statistical anomalies; they reflect a strategic pivot by both retail and institutional investors. For institutions, spot Bitcoin ETFs offer a regulated, familiar, and accessible pathway to gain exposure to Bitcoin without the complexities of direct ownership, such as managing private keys or navigating obscure exchanges. For retail investors, they provide an easy entry point into the Bitcoin market through traditional brokerage accounts, democratizing access to this innovative asset. Understanding the Impact of Consistent Bitcoin Inflows on Crypto Market Trends The continuous flow of capital into US Spot Bitcoin ETFs is having a palpable effect on broader Crypto Market Trends . Each day of positive inflows adds to Bitcoin’s liquidity and strengthens its market capitalization, often leading to upward price pressure. This sustained buying activity indicates that a significant amount of new capital is entering the Bitcoin ecosystem, rather than simply being reallocated within it. This trend is particularly significant because it suggests a maturation of the market. Unlike previous bull runs often fueled by speculative retail enthusiasm, the current environment is characterized by a more measured and institutional-led accumulation. This foundation of strong, consistent demand from regulated investment vehicles can lead to greater price stability and less volatility in the long run, making Bitcoin a more attractive asset for a wider range of investors. Moreover, these inflows act as a powerful validator for Bitcoin. The fact that sophisticated financial institutions are not only offering these products but also seeing substantial demand for them sends a clear message to the traditional financial world: Bitcoin is here to stay, and it’s becoming an indispensable part of diversified investment portfolios. This legitimization is crucial for fostering further growth and mainstream adoption. How is Institutional Adoption Shaping Bitcoin’s Future? The role of Institutional Adoption cannot be overstated when analyzing the current trajectory of Bitcoin. The launch of spot Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year marked a watershed moment, opening the floodgates for traditional financial players to engage with the digital asset space. This isn’t just about large sums of money; it’s about the stamp of approval from entities that manage trillions of dollars in assets. Consider the implications: Increased Legitimacy: When firms like BlackRock and Fidelity offer Bitcoin products, it lends immense credibility to the asset, dispelling previous notions of it being a niche or risky investment. Broader Access: Millions of investors who previously couldn’t or wouldn’t interact directly with cryptocurrencies can now gain exposure through their existing brokerage accounts, lowering the barrier to entry significantly. Market Maturation: Institutional involvement brings with it a demand for robust infrastructure, regulatory clarity, and professional-grade services, pushing the entire crypto ecosystem towards greater maturity and compliance. Long-Term Holding: Institutional investors typically have longer investment horizons compared to retail traders. Their accumulation often signifies a belief in Bitcoin’s long-term value proposition, contributing to a more stable market base. This growing embrace by institutions is transforming Bitcoin from a fringe asset into a recognized component of global finance. It’s a testament to Bitcoin’s resilience, its innovative technology, and its potential as a store of value in an increasingly uncertain economic landscape. What Do These Inflows Mean for BTC Price Action? The direct correlation between consistent Bitcoin Inflows and BTC Price Action is a topic of keen interest for investors. While market dynamics are complex and influenced by numerous factors, a sustained influx of capital into spot ETFs typically exerts upward pressure on Bitcoin’s price. This is due to the simple economic principle of supply and demand: increased demand for a relatively fixed supply of Bitcoin tends to drive its value higher. Each dollar flowing into a spot ETF theoretically requires the fund manager to purchase an equivalent amount of Bitcoin on the open market (or through OTC desks). This continuous buying pressure, day after day, absorbs available supply and can contribute to a positive price trajectory. Furthermore, the psychological impact of seeing consistent inflows can foster a bullish sentiment among market participants, encouraging further investment. However, it’s crucial to remember that the market is never a straight line. While inflows are a strong bullish indicator, BTC Price Action can still be influenced by macroeconomic factors, regulatory news, global events, and profit-taking by existing holders. Yet, the current trend suggests a strong underlying demand that provides a robust floor for Bitcoin’s price, potentially mitigating sharp downturns and supporting upward momentum. Actionable Insights: Navigating Current Crypto Market Trends For investors looking to understand the significance of these developments, here are some actionable insights derived from the current Crypto Market Trends : Monitor ETF Data: Keep a close eye on daily ETF inflow/outflow data. Consistent positive flows are a strong indicator of sustained demand and market health. Resources like those from Trader T on X, or official ETF provider reports, can be invaluable. Long-Term Perspective: The institutional interest reinforces Bitcoin’s long-term potential as a digital store of value and an inflation hedge. Consider a long-term investment strategy rather than short-term trading. Diversification: While Bitcoin is leading, the overall positive sentiment driven by institutional adoption can spill over into other major cryptocurrencies. However, always conduct thorough research before diversifying your portfolio. Stay Informed on Regulation: Regulatory clarity continues to be a major catalyst for institutional adoption. Keep abreast of global regulatory developments as they can significantly impact market sentiment and investment flows. Risk Management: Despite the positive outlook, the crypto market remains volatile. Invest only what you can afford to lose and consider dollar-cost averaging to mitigate price fluctuations. The current landscape suggests that Bitcoin is moving beyond its speculative phase and cementing its place within mainstream finance. These sustained inflows are not just numbers; they represent a fundamental shift in how the world views and invests in digital assets. A Future Forged by Confidence: Concluding Thoughts The remarkable 13-day streak of positive inflows into US Spot Bitcoin ETFs is more than just a headline; it’s a testament to the growing confidence in Bitcoin’s enduring value and its increasingly vital role in the global financial ecosystem. This sustained momentum, largely driven by significant institutional participation, underscores a profound shift in Crypto Market Trends , pointing towards greater maturity, stability, and widespread acceptance. As we witness this incredible surge, it becomes clear that Bitcoin is solidifying its position as a legitimate and attractive investment asset. The consistent Bitcoin Inflows are a powerful indicator of demand, paving the way for continued Institutional Adoption and potentially robust BTC Price Action . While the journey of any asset class involves fluctuations, the current trajectory suggests a future where Bitcoin is an undeniable force in the financial world, embraced by a broader spectrum of investors than ever before. This is an exciting time for digital assets, signaling a future forged by collective confidence and innovative financial products. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption. title: Ripple’s Escrow Dilemma After Torres Ruling: Who Really Owns the 37 Billion XRP?
body: Ripple’s control over 37 billion XRP in escrow is under renewed scrutiny following a recent court ruling. Legal experts, developers, and analysts debate whether Ripple truly relinquishes authority over the funds. Speculation is mounting that the U.S. government could intervene or even take control of the escrowed XRP. The debate over Ripple’s unilateral control of XRP tokens in its escrow has resurfaced in the crypto community. This comes as Ripple faces new legal hurdles in its case with the U.S. SEC. The development sparked bold suggestions from commentators like Brad Kimes , founder of XRPLasVegas, that the U.S. government may have to step in, particularly through Ripple’s escrow. Meanwhile, developers, legal observers, and blockchain analysts clash over whether Ripple truly relinquishes control of billions of XRP placed in escrow. U.S. Government to Take Over Ripple’s XRP in Escrow? Yesterday, Judge Analisa Torres rejected Ripple’s bid to vacate the existing injunction and reduce its federal penalty to $50 million. The court’s stance fuels speculation in the XRP community. In a tweet , Brad Kimes suggested the ruling may set up the U.… The post Ripple’s Escrow Dilemma After Torres Ruling: Who Really Owns the 37 Billion XRP? appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: Court adjourns until August 22 in AI chip fraud hearing for Singapore trio
body: Singapore’s court pushed back the hearing in its probe of three men tied to the alleged illegal transfer of Nvidia AI chips to China on Friday, setting the next date for August 22. Local media have linked the trio, Singaporeans Aaron Woon Guo Jie, 41, and Alan Wei Zhaolun, 49, alongside 51-year-old Chinese national Li Ming, to shipments destined for DeepSeek , a Chinese AI outfit. Prosecutors in Singapore want more time to scrutinize the documents The three were originally charged with fraud after authorities said they lied to unnamed server vendors about who would ultimately use the hardware. According to prosecutors, those false claims covered purchases made throughout 2023 and into 2024. The men stand accused of deliberately misrepresenting end users, a move Singapore courts treat very seriously, given the risk to international security. At Friday’s brief hearing, prosecutors told the court they need extra time to comb through fresh documents and to get replies from overseas entities involved in the transactions. Those responses are crucial, they said, to determine exactly how the chips were rerouted after leaving Singapore. According to Reuters , Dell Technologies and Super Micro Computer had supplied the servers to Singapore-based firms, which then shipped them on, reportedly to Malaysia, though their status as the final destination remains unclear. Deputy public prosecutor Phoebe Tan said that the police had been actively pursuing leads and carrying out further investigations from the very start. Since the last hearing on May 2, Tan said, the police had 10 follow-up interviews with persons of interest and the accused trio. According to Channel News Asia , Tan also revealed that police initiated contact with relevant agencies, including foreign ones, and are currently waiting for responses. Police have also examined 35 out of 53 electronic devices, while the rest are pending data extraction. Organized networks use Singapore as their layover to China Singapore’s Home Affairs Minister K. Shanmugam revealed in March that officials, acting on an anonymous tip-off, confirmed some of the servers likely carried Nvidia chips banned for export to China since 2022 over military-use fears. A senior US official separately reported that DeepSeek is assisting China’s military and intelligence operations. The local case is but one piece of a wider law-enforcement operation targeting 22 individuals and companies for similar deceptions, authorities say. They suspect an organized network has been leveraging Singapore as a route to funnel advanced AI processors into China, undermining export controls designed to curb Beijing’s defence applications. In Nvidia’s latest fiscal filing, Singapore ranks as the chipmaker’s second-largest market after the United States, accounting for 18% of its revenues. Yet, actual shipments to the city-state made up under 2% of total sales, since many customers use Singapore merely as an invoicing hub for dispatches elsewhere. The US clampdown, introduced in 2022, bars export of Nvidia’s top-end AI accelerators to China over national security issues. Since then, global watchdogs have warned of illicit trade routes, with some middlemen exploiting neutral jurisdictions to disguise end-user identities. The outcome of the case, whose next hearing is on August 22, could signal how far Singapore will go to deter chip-smuggling networks, and whether other regional hubs might tighten their own oversight to prevent similar schemes. title: INJ price under bearish pressure as Injective announces a new ecosystem growth initiative
body: Injective has just announced a new Revenue Fund aimed at boosting ecosystem growth just as the INJ token comes under pressure from a bearish chart pattern in the near term. On June 26th at the NYC Summit, Injective ( INJ ) announced the launch of Injective Revenue Fund, a new initiative designed to accelerate ecosystem development, scale on-chain revenue, and enhance INJ token’s deflationary mechanics . While specific implementation details are unclear at press time, the initiative will likely involve channeling protocol revenue into ecosystem expansion, supporting builders and dApps that drive user growth and network activity, and increasing token burns fueled by higher on-chain fee generation. The development comes at a pivotal moment as INJ price has recently broken below a key support level following the confirmation of a bearish head and shoulders pattern on the daily chart. The price dipped to an intraday low of $8.95 on June 22, testing a horizontal support zone established in early May, which now serves as a critical near-term level. You might also like: Staked Injective ETF in sight as Canary Capital registers Delaware trust INJ price is now hovering just beneath the broken neckline around $11.20, with momentum indicators — both RSI and MACD — reinforcing the bearish outlook, though the selling pressure appears to be weakening slightly. The token also fell below its 20-day EMA, signaling continued downside pressure in the near term unless a reclaim of the neckline occurs. Source: TradingVie w That said, the recent dip to $8.95 formed a higher low along the ascending long-term trendline, which formed after INJ price had reversed from $6.34 in early April — the lowest level since September 2023. This suggests that, despite the bearish breakdown, INJ remains technically within a broader uptrend, reinforced by its continued position above the 100-day SMA. If the price reclaims the neckline and closes above $11.30 – $12.00 with strong volume, the bearish scenario weakens. That would form a bear trap, and bulls could push to retest $14.30 — the swing high that marked the peak of the right shoulder. You might also like: Injective brings forex markets for EUR and GBP on-chain

title: South Korean payments firm Kakaopay tumbles 17% as regulators sound alarm on stablecoins
body: Shares of Kakaopay dropped sharply after volatile trading as regulators warn of risks tied to widespread stablecoin adoption. Shares of South Korean digital payments firm Kakaopay tumbled as much as 17% on June 27 after trading resumed Thursday, following a one-day suspension by the Korea Exchange, Bloomberg reported . The halt came just days after an earlier suspension on Tuesday, triggered by a sharp rally that saw the stock surge around 50% in two sessions. Moreover, the stock has tripled in value over the past month, fueled by investor excitement over the company’s potential move into stablecoins. Source: Bloomberg The exchange suspended the stock twice due to its extreme price volatility, ultimately designating Kakaopay as an “investment risk.” “Kakaopay was definitely overheated and went ahead of its fundamentals,” said Shawn Oh, an equities trader at NH Investment & Securities Co. in Seoul. “Going forward, the stock will face a reality check.” You might also like: South Korea’s top banks unite for Won-pegged stablecoin launch: report As previously reported by the Korea Times, Kakao Pay recently filed 18 trademark applications. KakaoBank, another major Kakao Group affiliate, has also submitted multiple trademark applications related to its stablecoin business, covering cryptocurrency software, financial transaction services, and mining under brand names such as BKRW and KRWB. “We submitted the trademark applications to proactively respond to developments in the stablecoin market,” a KakaoBank official said. “We will continue to carefully monitor relevant legal frameworks and market dynamics.” These moves coincide with accelerated legislative discussions in South Korea’s National Assembly on the Digital Asset Framework Act, which, once enacted, would permit issuance of won-pegged stablecoins and open the market to major financial and fintech firms like KakaoBank and Kakao Pay. However, the Bank of Korea recently cautioned that the widespread adoption of stablecoins could lead to risks including market instability caused by mass withdrawals (coin runs) and disturbances in the foreign exchange market. Similarly, the Bank for International Settlements noted that stablecoins are not a substitute for traditional money, and their future role remains “unclear.” You might also like: South Korean Democrats want to accelerate KRW stablecoin rollout

title: US Crypto Policy: GENIUS Act Poised to Unleash New Era for Stablecoin Regulation
body: BitcoinWorld US Crypto Policy: GENIUS Act Poised to Unleash New Era for Stablecoin Regulation The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with anticipation as July approaches, poised to become a landmark month for US crypto policy . From legislative breakthroughs to the potential reshaping of the digital asset landscape, key decisions are on the horizon that could redefine how cryptocurrencies operate within the United States. Are you ready for the seismic shifts about to hit the crypto ecosystem? What is the GENIUS Act and How Will it Impact Stablecoin Regulation? At the heart of the upcoming legislative changes is the GENIUS Act , a piece of legislation specifically designed to introduce stringent rules for stablecoin issuers. Stablecoins, digital currencies pegged to stable assets like the U.S. dollar, have become a cornerstone of the crypto economy, facilitating trades, remittances, and lending. However, their rapid growth has also raised concerns among regulators regarding consumer protection, financial stability, and illicit finance. The GENIUS Act is expected to bring much-needed clarity and oversight to this rapidly evolving sector. While the full details of the bill are yet to be widely publicized, reports suggest it will focus on: Reserve Requirements: Mandating that stablecoin issuers hold verifiable, high-quality reserves to back their tokens, ensuring a 1:1 peg and preventing situations like the TerraUSD collapse. Auditing and Transparency: Requiring regular, independent audits of stablecoin reserves and public disclosure of these reports, enhancing trust and accountability. Licensing and Supervision: Establishing a clear regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, potentially requiring them to obtain specific licenses and adhere to ongoing supervisory oversight by federal or state authorities. Consumer Protections: Implementing measures to safeguard user funds, including clear disclosures about risks, redemption rights, and mechanisms for dispute resolution. The implications of robust stablecoin regulation are far-reaching. For consumers, it could mean greater security and confidence in using stablecoins. For the industry, while compliance costs may increase, it could also pave the way for broader institutional adoption and integration of stablecoins into traditional financial systems, legitimized by a clear regulatory stamp. Who is David Sacks and What is His Role in Shaping US Crypto Policy? The recent insights into July’s legislative agenda come from David Sacks, notably referred to by Cointelegraph on X as the White House’s AI and crypto czar. While not a traditional government title, Sacks is a prominent figure in the tech and venture capital world, known for his involvement with PayPal and various successful tech companies. His statements carry significant weight, indicating a growing focus within high-level U.S. government circles on the burgeoning digital asset space. Sacks’s commentary underscores the administration’s recognition of cryptocurrencies and artificial intelligence as critical areas for national policy. His role, whether formal or advisory, highlights a concerted effort to bring clarity and structure to a sector that has largely operated in a regulatory grey area. The fact that someone with his reported influence is signaling a definitive timeline for significant legislation like the GENIUS Act emphasizes the urgency and priority placed on developing comprehensive US crypto policy . This engagement from figures like David Sacks suggests a shift from merely observing to actively shaping the future of digital assets, aiming to foster innovation while mitigating risks. It signals a more proactive stance from the U.S. government, moving towards a framework that seeks to integrate digital assets responsibly into the broader financial system. What Does the CLARITY Bill Mean for the Crypto Market Structure? Beyond stablecoins, July is also slated to be crucial for broader crypto market structure. The CLARITY crypto market structure bill is reportedly heading to the Senate, promising to provide much-needed guidance for the entire digital asset ecosystem. Currently, the classification of digital assets (e.g., as securities or commodities) remains a significant point of contention, leading to regulatory uncertainty and hindering innovation. The CLARITY bill aims to address this ambiguity by potentially: Defining Digital Asset Classifications: Establishing clear legal definitions for various types of digital assets, helping exchanges, developers, and investors understand which regulations apply to them. Jurisdictional Clarity: Specifying which regulatory bodies (e.g., SEC, CFTC) have oversight over different aspects of the crypto market, reducing inter-agency disputes and providing a single point of contact for compliance. Market Integrity Rules: Introducing rules around trading practices, preventing market manipulation, and ensuring fair and orderly markets, similar to those in traditional finance. Investor Protection Frameworks: Creating robust frameworks to protect retail and institutional investors from fraud, scams, and market volatility, potentially through disclosure requirements and investor education initiatives. A clear and consistent crypto market structure is vital for the industry’s maturation. It would allow businesses to innovate with greater confidence, attract more institutional capital, and provide a safer environment for individual participants. This bill, alongside the GENIUS Act, represents a holistic approach to regulating the digital economy, moving beyond piecemeal enforcement actions to a comprehensive legislative framework. The Road Ahead: Navigating New Stablecoin Regulation and Crypto Market Structure With the GENIUS Act expected to be signed into law and the CLARITY bill progressing through the Senate, the coming months will demand significant adaptation from all participants in the crypto space. The new era of stablecoin regulation will require issuers to re-evaluate their operational models, reserve management, and compliance protocols. This could lead to a consolidation in the stablecoin market, with only the most robust and compliant entities surviving and thriving. For the broader crypto market structure , exchanges, DeFi protocols, and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) will need to carefully analyze the new classifications and jurisdictional mandates. This might necessitate changes in how tokens are listed, how trading platforms operate, and how investor funds are handled. While challenging, this regulatory clarity could ultimately unlock significant growth by fostering trust and attracting mainstream financial institutions that have been hesitant due to regulatory uncertainty. Actionable Insights for the Crypto Community: Stay Informed: Closely monitor official announcements and detailed breakdowns of the GENIUS Act and CLARITY bill as they become public. Assess Impact: Businesses should conduct internal assessments to understand how the new regulations will affect their operations, products, and services. Engage with Policy Makers: Industry associations and individual companies should consider engaging with lawmakers and regulators to provide feedback and advocate for practical implementation. Prioritize Compliance: Start preparing for potential compliance requirements now, even before the full details are solidified. This includes reviewing internal controls, data management, and legal frameworks. The legislative push reflects a global trend towards greater oversight of digital assets. The U.S., as a major financial hub, plays a crucial role in setting precedents. The decisions made in July will not only impact the domestic market but could also influence regulatory approaches worldwide, shaping the global future of finance. A Transformative July for US Crypto Policy July is undeniably set to be a transformative month for the U.S. crypto landscape. With the anticipated signing of the GENIUS Act and the progression of the CLARITY bill, the U.S. is moving decisively towards a more regulated and defined digital asset ecosystem. This legislative push, championed by influential figures like David Sacks, signals a clear intent to foster responsible innovation, enhance investor protection, and integrate cryptocurrencies more formally into the financial system. While the path to compliance may present challenges, the long-term benefits of clarity and stability could unleash unprecedented growth and mainstream adoption for digital assets. The crypto community must remain vigilant, adaptable, and proactive to navigate this pivotal moment and seize the opportunities it presents. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping stablecoin regulation and institutional adoption. This post US Crypto Policy: GENIUS Act Poised to Unleash New Era for Stablecoin Regulation first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Ethereum Price Surge Above $2,500—But Is a Pullback Coming?
body: The post Ethereum Price Surge Above $2,500—But Is a Pullback Coming? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Recently, this final week of June, the Ethereum price has demonstrated a powerful spike, decisively breaking above and re-testing the crucial $2,500 mark. This upward movement reflects a notable price action in ETH crypto driven by a confluence of factors that signal strong bullish sentiment, but also caution against potential short-term volatility has appeared as it began consolidating in $2400- $2500 range. Even popular analyst Degen Hardy noted with caution that he will stay long on ETH as long as it remains above the $2,400 mark. As he believes in the short term, if $2400 is taken out, it will mean that bulls are struggling to reclaim untapped weekly highs. As the second-largest cryptocurrency with $295 billion market cap commands attention, as understanding these underlying forces is crucial for traders and investors alike. Keep reading to know more. Shifting Sentiment and the Impact of Short Squeezes A recent study from a CryptoQuant analyst reported a shift in funding rates on Binance, moving from negative to positive territory. Indicating leveraged long positions are aggressively betting on a continued ETH price rise. Per the analyst, this reflects widespread optimism, but it also raises severe concerns of the market turning into “overheating,” where further increases could precede with a short-term correction. Inflows Signal Potential Selling Pressure Analyst further adds that on-chain data presents a cautionary note, despite the recent strong price action, which was primarily driven by geopolitical ease with war-involved countries agreeing to a ceasefire. As the data reveals, Binance witnessed an inflow of 177,000 ETH over three consecutive days. This movement of ETH crypto onto exchanges has higher odds that some large holders may be preparing to take profits or reallocate their assets. [post_titles_links postid=”475660″] Ethereum Awaiting Correction In Short-Term Outlook Ethereum’s spike clearly highlights the aggressive speculative activity, but the simultaneous and substantial inflow of ETH crypto onto Binance points to a looming possibility of selling pressure, too. Even analysts like Hardy are cautious and willing to close their running positions if bulls can’t push higher in the short term. This increases the likelihood of a dip coming, as the market might aim to normalize the current overheated funding dynamics. $ETH UPDATE Still in my LONG position as long as we hold above this zone ($2.4K) Will cut it if we break down, bulls are struggling to get to the untapped weekly above. Watching closely, lock in profits if you haven't done so already. pic.twitter.com/Psg9VdF7I4 — Hardy (@Degen_Hardy) June 27, 2025 While a retracement might be on the horizon in the short term, the underlying long-term bullish structure of Ethereum crypto price appears intact. In addition, if the box’s lower border is breached, then short-term fall will pull ETH price to June 22nd low at $2120, but if the upper border is pierced, then the minimum aim is set at $2620. While Ethereum is trusted for its stout fundamentals, Bitcoin continues to dominate with its widespread adoption. How much would the price of Ethereum be in 2040? As per our Ethereum price prediction 2040, Ethereum could reach a maximum price of $123,678. How much will the ETH coin price be in 2050? By 2050, a single Ethereum price could go as high as $255,282.

title: BNB Chain Recognizes June 27 BNB Hack Winners as PlayAI Advances to Tier 3
body: Dubai, UAE, June 27th, 2025, Chainwire BNB Chain , the community-driven blockchain ecosystem, today announced the winners of its June 27 batch of the BNB Hack , which continues to support innovation across AI, DeSoc, DeSci, DePIN, and the broader Web3 space. After a rigorous evaluation of over 20 submissions from this batch, PlayAI (AI Track) emerged as the latest Tier 3 winner, while three additional projects—Twazi (AI Track), Coinbasket (AI Track), and SeniorFi (DeSoc Track)—were selected as Tier 4 potential awardees. Since its launching, BNB Hack has received more than 180 submissions from builders worldwide. Through its flexible, bi-weekly evaluation system, the program has recognized a total of 6 Tier 3 winners and 38 potential awardees. Projects benefit from tiered rewards, continuous feedback, and ecosystem support that helps accelerate their path to real-world deployment. The newly elevated Tier 3 project empowers DeFi automation by using unique AI integrations, secured $3,000 USDT rewards, $50,000 Kickstart Package, and Demo Opportunity. PlayAI : an AI-powered DeFi automation platform that recently launched its BNB yield optimizer workflow, enabling users to maximize returns across BNB Chain protocols like Venus, ListaDAO, and KernelDAO through prompt-based staking, now in public beta with 36K+ signups and a TGE campaign underway. Three additional projects demonstrated strong potential and were selected for Tier 4 status. They will continue to receive technical support, visibility, and evaluation for future tier advancement: Twazi : A no-code workflow platform for building AI-powered trading bots and DeFi automation pipelines. Coinbasket : An AI-driven crypto portfolio builder that creates personalized baskets based on natural language prompts, leveraging real-time data and autonomous agents. SeniorFi : A platform that tokenizes future receivables from elderly care institutions into tradable digital assets, using AI for risk analysis and ensuring compliance with Brazilian digital asset regulations. BNB Hack has become a dynamic launchpad for blockchain innovation. Past awardees continue to deliver results with growing traction, product upgrades, and ecosystem impact. Highlights include: Tearline : Achieved 2.8M+ interactions on BNB Chain. WORLD3 : Recorded 164K+ agent transactions and 300K+ in-game interactions in June. SentismAI : Surpassed $3M in trading volume with 100+ agents and 22K MiniApp users. TagAI : Integrated with Binance Wallet, hitting $45M+ in trading volume. Tutorial Agent , Stitch AI , Visualyze , and others have demonstrated significant on-chain activity, strategic partnerships, and ongoing product enhancements. BNB Hack is open to builders at any stage, from solo developers to early startups. Successful projects unlock rewards of up to $10,000 in cash and a $50,000 Kickstart package, and may be considered for MVB , the BNB Demo Day, and official demo opportunities. Projects must have launched on testnet or mainnet after February 12, 2025 . Applications for the next batch are open until July 9. Interested builders can apply here . About BNB Chain BNB Chain is a community-driven blockchain ecosystem that is removing barriers to Web3 adoption. It is composed of: BNB Smart Chain (BSC) : A secure DeFi hub with the lowest gas fees of any EVM-compatible L1; serves as the ecosystem’s governance chain. opBNB : A scalability L2 that delivers some of the lowest gas fees of any L2 and rapid processing speeds. BNB Greenfield : Meets decentralized storage needs for the ecosystem and lets users establish their own data marketplaces. Setting a high bar for security, the AvengerDAO community protects BNB Chain users while Red Alarm provides a real-time risk-scanner for Dapps. The ecosystem also offers a range of monetary and ecosystem rewards as part of its Builder Support Program . Tooling, such as the AI Solution , is also available for developers to explore. For more, users can follow BNB Chain on X or start exploring via Dapp library . Contact BNB Chain press@bnbchain.org

title: Wall Street Meets Ripple: The BlackRock XRP ETF
body: In June 2025, the crypto world was afire with rumors that BlackRock—the largest asset manager in the world, with $11 trillion in assets under management—was going to submit an application for a spot XRP ETF. Although the rumors are yet to be confirmed by any official SEC filing or BlackRock press release, the mere possibility has reverberated across traditional finance and the digital asset universe. So what exactly is an XRP ETF, how would it work, and why is the potential entrance of BlackRock such a big deal? What Is an XRP ETF? An XRP ETF (Exchange-Traded Fund) is an investment product designed to track the price action of XRP, the Ripple Labs cryptocurrency. Instead of buying XRP directly from a cryptocurrency exchange, investors can buy shares of the ETF in regular brokerage accounts. A share represents a proportionate interest in the underlying XRP position of the fund. The following is a general description of how an XRP ETF operates: Fund Creation : The issuer (e.g., BlackRock) buys XRP or related instruments to back the ETF. Asset Backing : The value of each ETF share is directly proportional to the amount of XRP the fund is holding. Exchange Trading : Shares are listed on stock exchanges and traded the same as common stocks. Net Asset Value (NAV) : The NAV is the total value of the XRP in the fund divided by outstanding shares, though market prices may vary slightly depending on trading volume. Management Fees : Issuers charge a small percentage as a management fee for operating the fund. This arrangement allows investors to gain exposure to XRP's price movement without the hassle of private keys, wallets, or having to interact with crypto exchanges. Why Does BlackRock's Interest Matter So Much? BlackRock's push into Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs was a landmark moment for institutional crypto adoption. The firm's reputation and regulatory strictness gave Wall Street's stamp of approval to digital assets, paving the way for pension funds, hedge funds, and retail investors who were wary of taking direct crypto exposure. A BlackRock XRP ETF application would signal growing confidence in the regulatory status of XRP along with its utilization as a mainstream asset. It would greatly help improve liquidity, market stability, and potentially drive XRP's price much higher than its all-time highs, according to industry watchers. The Current State Despite the hype, there is no official word from the official sources that BlackRock has filed—or will imminently file—for an XRP ETF. Previous speculation in April and May 2025 was not based on facts, and BlackRock representatives have repeatedly indicated they are not currently interested in altcoins like XRP, in large part due to ongoing legal uncertainty regarding Ripple and the SEC. Other managers, including Franklin Templeton, Grayscale, and 21Shares, have already applied for spot XRP ETFs and are awaiting SEC rulings. The SEC recently delayed a decision on several of these products, pointing to the regulatory uncertainty that still exists. What Would Happen If BlackRock Filed for an XRP ETF? If BlackRock were to actually file for an XRP ETF, the impact would be seismic: Wider Access : Traditional investors could invest in XRP through traditional brokerage accounts, without the complexity of crypto wallets and private keys. Liquidity Boost : The influx of institutional money would initiate greater trading volumes and market depth, reducing volatility. Price Effect : Analysts have predicted that XRP could double in price, potentially surpassing its all-time high of $3.40 and even reaching as high as $4.60 within months, after the same explosive rallies that happened when Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs were added. Legitimacy Boost : BlackRock's involvement would be a powerful vote of confidence in XRP, potentially impacting public and institutional attitudes and further mainstream adoption. How an XRP ETF Bridges Traditional and Crypto Finance ETFs are a familiar wrapper for traditional investors, offering regulatory oversight, ease of access, and transparency. By putting XRP into this wrapper, an ETF would be capable of bridging the gap between traditional finance and the evolving landscape of digital assets. This would open the door to a whole new wave of investors that have been deterred by the technical and security concerns of direct crypto ownership. The Road Ahead While the expectation is genuine, caution is warranted. The history of false starts among the XRP community can only serve to highlight the need for skepticism until there is an actual filing. Regulatory clarity remains a significant hurdle, and BlackRock's risk aversion will have it potentially waiting for the green light from the SEC before making a move. Still, the sheer speculation testifies to the growing appetite for crypto entry into mainstream finance. With regulatory clarity and institutional interest on the rise, the prospect of an XRP ETF—one backed by a giant like BlackRock—could be closer than most expect. In brief : The idea of a BlackRock XRP ETF is so far speculation, but if it does materialize at some time in the future, it would be a game-changer for XRP and the crypto space in general, opening the doors to institutional money and mainstream adoption. Until that time, investors would do well to watch SEC filings—and the news wires—very closely.

By putting XRP into this wrapper, an ETF would be capable of bridging the gap between traditional finance and the evolving landscape of digital assets. This would open the door to a whole new wave of investors that have been deterred by the technical and security concerns of direct crypto ownership. The Road Ahead While the expectation is genuine, caution is warranted. The history of false starts among the XRP community can only serve to highlight the need for skepticism until there is an actual filing. Regulatory clarity remains a significant hurdle, and BlackRock's risk aversion will have it potentially waiting for the green light from the SEC before making a move. Still, the sheer speculation testifies to the growing appetite for crypto entry into mainstream finance. With regulatory clarity and institutional interest on the rise, the prospect of an XRP ETF—one backed by a giant like BlackRock—could be closer than most expect. In brief : The idea of a BlackRock XRP ETF is so far speculation, but if it does materialize at some time in the future, it would be a game-changer for XRP and the crypto space in general, opening the doors to institutional money and mainstream adoption. Until that time, investors would do well to watch SEC filings—and the news wires—very closely.

title: Ethereum Holds $2400 as Whale Accumulation Surges: Is a Bullish Breakout Imminent?
body: The post Ethereum Holds $2400 as Whale Accumulation Surges: Is a Bullish Breakout Imminent? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The Ethereum (ETH) price is navigating within a tight range near $2450, struggling to break out decisively as traders await clarity from both macro events and technical events. The second-largest crypto has bounced between $2400 and $2460 over the past 24 hours, reflecting indecision despite bullish whale activity and growing institutional interest. Alongside, the whales have also intensified the accumulation of Ethereum, which can be considered a bullish signal for the token. As per the data from Cryptoquant, Ethereum whales have recorded one of the highest accumulations ever in the cycle. On the other hand, the active address spiked instantly from 289,275 to as high as 515,432, hinting towards a massive rise in the traders’ activity. Hence, with a rise in the volatility, the ETH price could also attract a positive impact. Is a Short Squeeze Incoming? A short squeeze occurs when the traders who have shorted the token are compelled to buy back at a higher price. This covers their losses and also helps the price climb instantly. The current on-chain readings suggest an enormous amount of shorts have been accumulated, which could pave the way for a sudden rise in the price soon. The chart shows a huge accumulation of shorts in the past few days as the price was about to secure the resistance at $2800. This quickly drives the price lower, and now that it is trying to recover, the shorts are feared to get liquidated. A significant amount of liquidity has been piled up around $2500, and hence, a rise above the level could eventually squash the shorts. Will the Ethereum (ETH) Price Reach $3000? The Ethereum price has been trading within a narrow range while plunging heavily during the latest pullback. Despite this, the price has held along a strong support, hence paving the way to reach the resistance. Besides, the volume has also been making moves, hinting towards a substantial rise in the volatility as well. As seen in the above chart, the price has rebounded from the support of the Gaussian channel, which suggests excessive price drain. However, the CMF remains stuck below ‘0,’ hinting towards a drop in the money flow onto the platform. Therefore, the Ethereum price is believed to reach $2500, and if the market conditions are favorable, then a rise above $2800 is imminent. Otherwise, the price may continue to consolidate below the price range.

title: XRP Surpasses BTC, ETH in This Surprising Metric Despite SEC Lawsuit Roadblock
body: TL:DR Ripple’s lawsuit resolution against the US SEC will have to wait even longer as Judge Torres denied the two parties’ joint motion for an indicative ruling. However, this seemingly negative development has turned the community bullish on XRP, according to data from Santiment. With crypto moving sideways, retail optimism toward Bitcoin & Ethereum has died down a bit. Meanwhile, XRP sentiment is currently at a 17-day high, in terms of positive vs. negative commentary. This has happened after a $50M settlement between Ripple & the SEC was stalled. pic.twitter.com/zJctKgEiPf — Santiment (@santimentfeed) June 27, 2025 As the analytics company informed, the bullish vs. bearish posts on social media in regards to the fourth-largest cryptocurrency have skyrocketed to a 17-day high. Consequently, XRP has surpassed the two biggest digital assets by market cap, bitcoin and ether, both of which are performing a lot better in terms of price actions in the past week or so. BTC managed to reclaim the $100,000 line after its brief hiatus below it and now sits at around $107,000 as the geopolitical environment in the Middle East improved. ETH also recovered from its substantial slump and is back to $2,400. In contrast, XRP’s price has been trading downward for weeks and is currently below $2.1 after another 3-4% daily drop. The latest setback took place yesterday following Judge Torres’s decision to deny the joint motion filed by Ripple and the SEC for a quicker resolution in their lawsuit. Nevertheless, it’s not all doom and gloom as the XRP token saw a major adoption announcement earlier this week, as you can check here . The post XRP Surpasses BTC, ETH in This Surprising Metric Despite SEC Lawsuit Roadblock appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Kenya Proposes Joint Crypto Regulatory Body as Nation Eyes Leadership in African Crypto Space
body: The post Kenya Proposes Joint Crypto Regulatory Body as Nation Eyes Leadership in African Crypto Space appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News With the cryptocurrency market booming in 2025, Kenya has taken a major step toward regulating digital assets. The country’s National Assembly Finance and Planning Committee has proposed the formation of a multi-agency regulatory framework to oversee crypto operations, marking a pivotal moment for the region’s virtual asset industry. Kenya’s New Crypto Regulatory Framework Driven by the explosive growth of the crypto sector, Kenyan lawmakers are moving quickly to establish oversight mechanisms. The proposed framework brings together five key government agencies to regulate Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs): Central Bank of Kenya Capital Markets Authority Competition Authority of Kenya Communications Authority of Kenya Office of the Data Protection Commissioner These bodies will collectively regulate various aspects of the crypto ecosystem, including market conduct, data protection, and digital infrastructure. Why Kenya Introduced This Crypto Proposal The proposal stems from a recommendation by Credence Sfrica, a social enterprise organization, which called for a cross-sectoral regulatory team to supervise the rapidly expanding crypto market. The initiative is now open for public feedback, as the Finance Committee aims to build a collaborative and transparent crypto policy. Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs) Bill Gains Momentum Introduced on April 4, 2025, the Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASP) Bill has received strong support from key players in the crypto industry. The Virtual Asset Chamber (VAC) praised the bill but recommended removing a controversial clause that allowed regulators to conduct off-site surveillance of VASPs without clear boundaries. The committee agreed with the VAC and has amended the bill accordingly. [post_titles_links postid=”475547″] Kenya Aims to Become Africa’s Crypto Hub Kenya is positioning itself as a crypto leader in Africa, moving past its earlier caution. The new VASP Bill is designed to strengthen financial transparency, accountability, and combat illicit financial flows. Lawmakers believe it will help protect consumers and legitimize the crypto space in the country. Key Requirement for VASPs If the bill is passed, all entities engaging in crypto operations in Kenya will be required to obtain a local license approved by the five regulatory agencies. These licensed VASPs must also implement internal policies to identify and manage conflicts of interest and report such matters to authorities. “This Bill puts a strong emphasis on conflict prevention and proper management among virtual asset providers,” said MP Kimani Kuria . “It requires entities to establish effective internal controls to ensure transparency and accountability.” Final Thoughts As Kenya prepares to pass its first comprehensive crypto regulation , it sends a clear signal of intent: the nation is serious about embracing digital finance while safeguarding its citizens. If implemented successfully, this could place Kenya at the forefront of Africa’s blockchain revolution. [article_inside_subscriber_shortcode title=”Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World!” description=”Stay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more.” category_name=”News” category_id=”6″] FAQs How much tax will I pay on crypto in Kenya? In Kenya, a 1.5% tax is imposed on every crypto transaction, which applies to transfers and exchanges regardless of whether a gain is made. This is a revised rate from an earlier 3%. Why is Kenya introducing this new crypto regulatory framework? Kenya aims to regulate its booming crypto sector to enhance financial transparency, accountability, combat illicit financial flows, protect consumers, and legitimize the crypto space, positioning itself as an African crypto hub. What is the Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASP) Bill in Kenya? Introduced on April 4, 2025, the VASP Bill is Kenya’s comprehensive legislation to license and regulate crypto operations. It emphasizes conflict prevention and requires VASPs to implement internal controls for transparency.

title: Across Protocol: Alarming Allegations of $23M ACX Token Misappropriation Emerge
body: BitcoinWorld Across Protocol: Alarming Allegations of $23M ACX Token Misappropriation Emerge The world of decentralized finance (DeFi) thrives on trust, transparency, and community governance. Yet, recent allegations have sent shockwaves through this very foundation, raising serious questions about the integrity of a prominent cross-chain intents protocol. Across Protocol , a name synonymous with bridging digital assets, now finds itself at the center of a storm involving alleged financial misconduct and manipulated governance votes. If true, these claims could profoundly impact investor confidence and the future of DeFi governance. What Are the Core Allegations Against Across Protocol? At the heart of the controversy are startling claims made by Ogle, an advisor at World Liberty Financial (WLFI). In a recent X post, Ogle accused the Across Protocol team of orchestrating a scheme to siphon off a staggering $23 million in ACX tokens . The alleged method? Manipulating the outcome of a crucial governance vote. Specifically, the accusation states that 150 million ACX tokens , valued at approximately $23 million at the time, were transferred to Risk Labs. Risk Labs is reportedly the for-profit entity behind Across Protocol . These transfers were allegedly disguised under the seemingly innocuous labels of “strategic investment” and “retroactive funding.” However, critics argue these labels served as a cover for a direct transfer of community-held assets into the hands of the protocol’s core team. Unpacking the Alleged ACX Tokens Vote Manipulation The gravity of the situation deepens when examining the mechanics of the alleged manipulation. Ogle’s post meticulously details how the Across Protocol team purportedly leveraged ‘insider addresses’ to sway the results of the governance vote manipulation . In a truly decentralized system, governance proposals are meant to be decided by the collective will of token holders, ensuring fair and transparent decision-making. However, according to the allegations, these insider addresses were strategically deployed to push the proposal past the required quorum. Ogle emphasized that without the engagement of these ‘insider’ votes, the proposal would have failed due to insufficient participation. This suggests a deliberate effort to bypass genuine community consensus, undermining the very principles of decentralized governance. The direct consequence of these actions, as highlighted by Ogle, is the creation of potential token selling pressure, which directly harms legitimate ACX token holders. Why Do Governance Vote Manipulation Claims Matter in DeFi? The allegations against Across Protocol are not just about a large sum of money; they strike at the core of what decentralized finance security aims to achieve. DeFi protocols are designed to operate without central intermediaries, relying instead on smart contracts and community-driven governance. This model promises transparency, censorship resistance, and true user ownership. However, incidents like the alleged governance vote manipulation by the Across Protocol team expose critical vulnerabilities. When the very mechanisms designed to ensure fairness can be exploited by those in power, it erodes trust. This raises fundamental questions: Can users truly trust a system where insider interests can override community consensus? How robust are existing governance frameworks against such alleged exploits? What recourse do token holders have when their collective power is allegedly undermined? These questions are vital for the long-term health and adoption of DeFi. The integrity of governance votes is paramount, as it dictates the future direction, treasury allocation, and overall security of a protocol. The Wider Impact of Crypto Allegations on Trust Beyond the immediate financial implications for ACX token holders, these crypto allegations cast a long shadow over the broader decentralized finance ecosystem. Trust is the bedrock of any financial system, and in the nascent world of DeFi, it is even more critical. Each alleged scandal, each instance of insider dealing, chips away at the collective confidence of investors, developers, and new entrants. Such incidents can lead to: Reduced Investor Confidence: Potential investors may become wary of participating in DeFi projects, fearing similar exploits. Regulatory Scrutiny: Allegations of manipulation and misappropriation often invite increased attention from regulators, potentially leading to stricter rules that could stifle innovation. Reputational Damage: Not just for the accused protocol, but for the entire sector, making it harder to attract mainstream adoption. Market Volatility: News of alleged misconduct can trigger sell-offs, further harming legitimate token holders. The DeFi space prides itself on its innovative spirit and commitment to decentralization. However, incidents that betray these principles are a stark reminder of the ongoing need for vigilance and robust ethical frameworks within the community. Navigating Decentralized Finance Security Challenges The alleged events surrounding Across Protocol underscore the persistent decentralized finance security challenges that the industry must continuously address. While DeFi offers immense opportunities, it also presents unique risks that differ from traditional finance. The immutability of blockchain transactions means that once an exploit or a malicious act occurs, it is incredibly difficult, if not impossible, to reverse. To bolster decentralized finance security and prevent future incidents of alleged governance vote manipulation , several measures are crucial: Enhanced Audits: Beyond code audits, governance mechanisms themselves need rigorous scrutiny to identify potential vulnerabilities for manipulation. Transparent On-Chain Data: Tools and platforms that make it easier for the community to monitor voting patterns, large token movements, and treasury transactions can serve as early warning systems. Stronger Community Engagement: Actively encouraging a broader base of token holders to participate in governance can dilute the power of concentrated insider interests. Clear Disclosure Policies: Protocols should have explicit rules regarding team holdings, vesting schedules, and any potential conflicts of interest related to governance. Legal Recourse: While challenging in a decentralized environment, exploring frameworks for accountability and recourse for affected token holders is essential for maturing the space. The allegations against Across Protocol serve as a potent reminder that decentralization is not a magic bullet against all forms of misconduct. It requires continuous effort, community oversight, and a commitment to ethical practices from all participants. What’s Next for Across Protocol and ACX Holders? As these serious allegations circulate, the eyes of the crypto community will remain fixed on Across Protocol . It is crucial for the protocol’s team to address these claims transparently and provide a comprehensive response to the community. For ACX token holders, understanding the full implications of these alleged actions on their investments and the protocol’s long-term viability is paramount. The coming weeks and months will likely determine how this situation evolves and whether the community’s trust can be restored. Conclusion The alleged misappropriation of $23 million in ACX tokens by the Across Protocol team, facilitated by alleged governance vote manipulation , is a deeply concerning development for the DeFi ecosystem. It highlights the critical need for robust decentralized finance security measures and unwavering transparency. While the promise of decentralization remains strong, incidents like this underscore the ongoing challenges in building truly equitable and trustworthy systems. The crypto community must remain vigilant, advocating for greater accountability and stronger governance frameworks to safeguard the future of DeFi. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends and decentralized finance security, explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi governance and institutional adoption. This post Across Protocol: Alarming Allegations of $23M ACX Token Misappropriation Emerge first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team
